page.title: 14The Peoples of Deeside
page.content: To this writer there appear distinct groups of people within the locality. These groups have an identity which they maintain through their attitudes and behavior. While they will interrelate through common interest activities, individuals, families and neighbourhoods display cohesion and often prejudice of a social nature. There are stolid, native Deesiders who display the confidence of their roots in successive generations. There are those who have retired to the locality from professional employment, often military. There are the nouveau riche of oil-related employment who have moved to the area as an attractive place to settle and bring up family amongst the advantages of quality housing, good and convenient education and a safe and stimulating environment.
